actor

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • actor.Actor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Elf, Hobbit, Orc, Wizard

    public abstract class Actor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Actor class is the super class for all different types of Actor subclasses. The Actor class tracks state information for individual actors in the simulation: name, health, strength, speed, etc (and later, a screen avatar with coordinates). Additional attributes are tracked in the subclasses. The behaviours (moving and battling) are defined in the subclasses. Actor class is currently a concrete class. Later, the Actor class will become an abstract class where no Actor objects will ever be created -- only subclass objects.
    Version:
    Lab Assignment 4: The Hobbit Battlefield Simulator
    Author:
    Rex Woollard
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int actorSerialNumber
      static variable used to embed sequence number in Actor names; because it is static, there is one-and-only-one instance of this variable regardless of the number of Actor objects in existence (from none to infinity).
      protected Army armyAllegiance
      Used to assist in finding nearest opposing Actor; this ActorArmy search the opposing Army, thus the Army will need to know who the opposing Army is, but that's the Army responsibility.
      private javafx.beans.property.SimpleDoubleProperty health
      influences ability to survive damage inflicted in skirmish with other players; can also influence mobility (along with speed); stored in a SimpleDoubleProperty to implement the Observable design pattern.
      static double MAX_HEALTH
      Upper boundary on health attribute, currently:100.0
      static double MAX_SPEED
      Upper boundary on speed attribute, currently:100.0
      static double MAX_STRENGTH
      Upper boundary on strength attribute, currently:100.0
      static double MIN_HEALTH
      Lower boundary on health attribute, currently:1.0
      static double MIN_SPEED
      Lower boundary on speed attribute, currently:10.0
      static double MIN_STRENGTH
      Lower boundary on strength attribute, currently:10.0
      private javafx.beans.property.SimpleStringProperty name
      stores the actual Actor's name, for example, "Gandalf the Gray"
      private javafx.beans.property.SimpleDoubleProperty speed
      influences speed of movement; stored in a SimpleDoubleProperty to implement the Observable design pattern.
      private javafx.beans.property.SimpleDoubleProperty strength
      influences degree of damage inflicted in skirmish with other players; stored in a SimpleDoubleProperty to implement the Observable design pattern.
      static double THRESHOLD_OF_ADEQUATE_HEALTH
      Defines threshold for ability to move; value is 0.0 to 1.0, currently:0.3
      private javafx.scene.control.Tooltip tooltip
      Is associated with the avatar and is used to display on-screen information about the Actor object.
      private javafx.animation.TranslateTransition tt
      Used to manage the avatar motion under JavaFX.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Actor(int subclassCount, Army armyAllegiance)
      Actor constructor is used when building Actor objects automatically: strength, health, speed fields are given randomly generated values within their range; name is given a sequentially numbered name: Auto:n where n is the sequence number.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Actor

        public Actor(int subclassCount,
             Army armyAllegiance)
        Actor constructor is used when building Actor objects automatically: strength, health, speed fields are given randomly generated values within their range; name is given a sequentially numbered name: Auto:n where n is the sequence number. The name can be edited to create an unique Actor.
        Parameters:
        subclassCount - used to support automatic naming (which includes a unique serial number).
        armyAllegiance - used to support the Army-specific DropShadow glow around this Actor object.

        Actor regain health on each cycle of the simulation (and loose health in battles handled by other code).

      • getHitPoints

        public double getHitPoints()

      • combatRound

        public double combatRound(Actor defender)
        processes a single round of combat between two Actor objects: the attacker is this object; the defender is received as an argument. This method is called by the attacker Actor object. This attacker Actor object chooses another Actor object as the defender by sending a reference-to the second Actor object. When program execution arrives in combatRound, the method will have access to 2 sets of Actor attributes (a.k.a. instance fields). In particular, this method will need to use health and strength to process a single round of combat. As an outcome of the single round, both Actor objects: the attacker and the defender are likely to loose some health value, but the Actor object with less strength will likely incur more damage to their health. You access the attacker instance fields (such as health using this.health and the defender instance fields using defender.health. Of course, defender is the name of the stack-oriented reference-to variable that is sent to the method.
        Parameters:
        defender - a reference to a different Actor object that will engage in combat with this Actor object.
        Returns:
        health of the Actor following the combat round.

      • isHealthyEnoughToMove

        public boolean isHealthyEnoughToMove()
        based on health determines if the Actor is healthy enough to move; returns a true or false value
        Returns:
        boolean value representing whether the Actor can move.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        overrides the superclass (Object) version of toString() and provides a textual representation of the Actor object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • createAvatar

        public abstract void createAvatar()
        Each subclass will have a different look-and-feel. ALL subclasses MUST have and avatar, thus this abstract method enforces that requirement.

      • getAvatar

        public abstract javafx.scene.Node getAvatar()
        Each subclass can have a different Node (e.g. ImageView or Rectangle or Circle etc. They all return their reference-to as type Node, and Node is defined as an abstract type.

      • startMotion

        public void startMotion(boolean engageInCombat)
        Defines the characteristics of a TranslateTransition. Each call results in ONE segment of motion. When that segment is finished, it "chains" another call to startMotion() (which is NOT recursion)! The initial call is made by the managing Army object; subsequent calls are made through the "chaining" process described here.
        Parameters:
        engageInCombat - TODO
